meanings.definition: The action or process of indexing.
meanings.sent1: The indexations of the library books helped students find information easily.
meanings.sent2: The indexations of the files made it simple to locate specific documents.
meanings.sent3: The indexations of the recipe book were so detailed, they even included page numbers for ingredients.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like the indexations of a well-organized database, quickly retrieving memories.
meanings.sent5: The indexations of the map were color-coded, making navigation a breeze.

meanings.sent1: The indexations of the library were efficient and well-maintained.
meanings.sent2: The online indexations allowed users to search for information with ease.
meanings.sent3: The indexations of the filing system were so advanced, they seemed almost magical.
meanings.sent4: His brain functioned like the indexations of a complex algorithm, sorting through data effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The indexations of the encyclopedia were thorough, covering a wide range of topics.

meanings.definition: The act of providing an index for a book or other publication.
meanings.sent1: The indexations of the textbook were helpful for students studying for exams.
meanings.sent2: The indexations of the magazine made it convenient to locate articles of interest.
meanings.sent3: The indexations of the novel were so detailed, they even included subheadings for each chapter.
meanings.sent4: Her organizational skills were like the indexations of a professional indexer, ensuring easy access to information.
meanings.sent5: The indexations of the manual were user-friendly, guiding readers to relevant sections.
